snippet: Besides the unexpected 0.4 percent retail sales drop in January, more Americans filed for jobless benefits last week.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that retail sales fell by 0.4 percent in January 2014, and Labor Department says weekly initial claims for state unemployment benefits rose 8,000 to seasonally adjusted 339,000, signs that the economy started 2014 on softer footing as unseasonably cold weather took its toll.
lead_paragraph: Besides the unexpected 0.4 percent retail sales drop in January, more Americans filed for jobless benefits last week.

headline.main: Retail Sales Fall, and Economists Blame the Weather
headline.print_headline: Retail Sales Fall, and Economists Blame the Weather
